bwwExcerpt: Cordero is good and sleazy enough so that we never miss the original too much. He lacks Palminteri's heavy elegance, but his is an understated performance that gives the musical a solid foundation. Also very fine is the delectable Ariana Debose, who plays the love interest, and a gifted child actor named Hudson Loverro. The huge obstacle to overcome in putting "A Bronx Tale" on stage is finding the right kid for the early scenes. Problem solved: Loverro brings real street edge to the young Calog
